metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3470 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ssl3_send_client_key_exchange function in s3_clnt.c in OpenSSL before 0.9.8za, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0m, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1h, when an anonymous ECDH cipher suite is used, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and client crash) by triggering a NULL certificate value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3470` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.2
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.2').
